snippet: Ms. Smith, who is well-known in Washington development circles, would be in charge of the government’s response to humanitarian disasters and manage the agency’s $20 billion budget.
abstract: Pres Obama nominates Gayle Smith, senior White House official, to lead United States Agency for International Development; if confirmed by Senate, Smith would be in charge of government's response to humanitarian disasters and manage agency's $20 billion budget.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Smith, who is well-known in Washington development circles, would be in charge of the government’s response to humanitarian disasters and manage the agency’s $20 billion budget.

headline.main: Obama Nominates Gayle Smith to Lead U.S.A.I.D.
headline.print_headline: Obama Nominates a Leader for Aid Agency

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Agency for International Development
